cards.title: Delayed Rock Trap
body: Play this card next to a hero. When a card enters the environment trash, check that card.
If it is a fate card, this card deal the hero next to it {H} melee damage. If it is not a fate card, this card deals each other hero target {H-2} melee damage. Then, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: The flagstone sank into the floor,{BR}generating a series of faint,{BR}mechanical noises that echoed{BR}through the stones of the ceiling.

cards.title: Dubious Edibles
body: When this card enters play, check the top card of the environment trash.
If it is a fate card, this card deals each hero 1 toxic damage. If it is not a fate card, 1 hero target regains 4HP. Then, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: “I try not to make a habit of eating{BR}things I find while crawling around the{BR}sewers,” said Malichae. Gyrosaur{BR}blinked, then slowly took another bite.

cards.title: Enormous Pack
body: When this card enters play, check the top card of the environment trash.
If it is a fate card, 1 hero may play card, draw a card, or use a power. If it is not a fate card, the player with the most cards in hand discards 2 cards. Then, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: “Alain, give it up,” said Cricket. “No{BR}way,” panted the young knight.{BR}“We're stuck in a cursed book. No{BR}telling what might come in handy.”

cards.title: High Ground
body: While the top card of the environment trash is a fate card, reduce damage dealt by hero targets by 1. While it is not a fate card, reduce damage dealt by villain targets by 1.
At the start of the environment turn, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: As Gyrosaur scrambled to find cover{BR}from the demonic tattoos, she reflected{BR}on what a surprising combat advantage{BR}a few feet of elevation seemed to offer.

cards.title: Improbable Failure
body: At the start of each player's draw phase, discard and check the top card of the environment deck.
If it is a fate card, they skip the rest of their draw phase.
At the start of the environment turn, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: “Zhen de ma?!” exclaimed Terminus,{BR}staring at the broken axe in{BR}disbelief. “Why is the tree winning?{BR}Why was that even an option?!”

cards.title: Magic Blade
body: Play this card next to a hero. The first time they use a power each turn, discard and check the top card of the environment deck.
If it is a fate card, that hero deals 1 target 2 energy damage. If it is not a fate card, that hero deals themselves 2 infernal damage.
cards.flavorText: “Take heed, Lady Mormont,” said the{BR}Knight. “On the surface, a garish{BR}yet functional, blade. But I would{BR}not trust any weapon with a voice.”

cards.title: One in a Million
body: When this card enters play, discard and check the top 2 cards of the environment deck.
If at least 1 is a fate card, each player draws a card. If both are fate cards, skip the next villain turn. Then, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: Havoc cautiously lifted the blindfold{BR}to consider the inert monstrosity{BR}at his feet. “Huh.” He'd though that{BR}was going to be more difficult.

cards.title: Restful Inn
body: The first time a hero draws a card during their turn, they may discard it. If they do, that hero regains 2HP. Increase HP regained this way by 1 if the top card of the environment trash is a fate card.
At the start of the environment turn, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: Many travelers wound up slightly{BR}disappointed, for the sign was{BR}misleading: the bear did not dance. She{BR}preferred reading, and lively debates.

cards.title: Ring of Foresight
body: Play this card next to a hero. At the start of their turn, they regain 1HP.
When checking a card in the environment trash, the players may first destroy this card, and then check it instead of the original card.
cards.flavorText: Impact put the ring on without{BR}hesitation, and was not at all surprised{BR}when it began glowing. That was what{BR}rings did in situations like this: magic.

cards.title: Roving Slime
body: At the end of the environment turn, check the top card of the environment trash.
If it is a fate card, this card deals the hero target with the highest HP {H-1} toxic damage. If if is not a fate card, this card deals each non-environment target 1 toxic damage.
cards.flavorText: The Deck of Fate was not the only{BR}enchanted object that she had created{BR}based on a human game of chance: the{BR}Mistress of Fate also liked RPGs.

cards.title: Shopkeeper
body: When this card enters play, reveal the top card of each hero deck, and move it beneath this card. Cards beneath this one are not considered in play.
At the start of their turn, a player may discard a card to play or draw one of their cards from beneath this.
cards.flavorText: Vanish picked up a familiar-looking{BR}sword. “Hey, uh, Sir George, isn't{BR}this yours? How did our stuff{BR}make it in here ahead of us?”

cards.title: Stone Warden
body: At the end of the environment turn, check the top card of the environment trash.
If it is a fate card, this card deals the hero target with the highest HP {H} melee damage. If it is not a fate card, this card deals the non-environment target with the lowest HP 2 melee damage.
cards.flavorText: The field was littered with jagged{BR}shards of rock. No one noticed as the{BR}shards began to assemble themselves{BR}into a vaguely humanoid shape.

cards.title: Suspicious Chest
body: At the end of the environment turn, check the top card of the environment trash.
If it is a fate card, this card deals the hero target with the highest HP {H-1} toxic damage. If it is not a fate card, 1 player draws a card.
cards.flavorText: “Is this normal?” asked Pyre.{BR}Vanish nodded. “In these games{BR}people leave all kinds of stuff{BR}just lying about in chests.”

cards.title: There's Always a Bard
body: Play this card next to a hero. At the start of their turn, they may use a power, play a card, or destroy this card.
Damage dealt to the hero next to this card is irreducible and increased by 1.
cards.flavorText: Quicksilver scowled over her lute at{BR}Gargoyle's imposing armor. “Who{BR}picked these classes? Make this{BR}stupid book give me a better one”

cards.title: Underleveled
body: While the top card of the environment trash is a fate card, increase damage dealt by villain targets by 1. While it is not a fate card, increase damage dealt by hero targets by 1.
At the start of the environment turn, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: Cricket quickly slammed the door{BR} back shut. “You know, on second{BR}thought, this might not be the best{BR}area to start out in, Jai.”
